artist: Artist: Attributed to Joseph-Marie Vien; Artist: Attributed to Eustache Le Sueur
description: seated figure in a high-backed chair, seen in profile from PL, wearing voluminous robes and bishop's hat; head turned toward PR; mounted on heavy blue paper
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

at bottom center on mount, in black: [Eustache Lesueur. / (*1617 - Paris - 1655 (+)]; in bottom margin on mount, in pencil and blue ink: various notes and numbers; on back of mount, in pencil: [Lesueur]
markings: LRC, stamped in black: unidentified stamp
medium: Black and white chalk on gray paper
text: We believe that Joseph-Marie Vien is very likely the author of this drawing, based on comparison with drawings he is known to have made. French academic drawings are notoriously difficult to attribute because of the rigorous, standardized training required of all academy students. And because Vien was also a highly regarded teacher, he had many imitators. Still, features such as the treatment of the drapery, the insistent parallel hatching, the line ends that touch without overlapping, and the chunky hands all point to Vien.
title: Study of a Seated Model Wearing a Bishop's Chasuble and Mitre
